caption: I recently visited the Musée de Illusions Paris Roissy, and it was an awesome experience! It’s only been 2 days since I arrived in Paris from Pakistan, and this was one of the highlights of my trip so far. The illusions were mind-blowing, and I loved how interactive and fun the exhibits were. As a student, I got a half-priced ticket, which made the experience even better. The museum is definitely worth a visit for anyone looking for something unique and entertaining. The staff were friendly and the whole place was well-organized. A great way to spend a few hours in Paris.

Good spot for kids in the middle of a busy area. It is pretty small and should only take you about 30-45 minutes depending on how much time you spend at each exhibit. For the amount of time you spend here it is a bit pricey, but if you are desperate for something to entertain kids uninterested in the allure of Paris it is worth the stop.
Super fun place for family. It was relatively short tour but I got many good and fun pictures! My 10 year old girl loved this place!

It was a little short and crowded for a holiday weekend but that was to be expected. My 4 yo loved the illusions regardless. The nice man who checked us in also got us in quicker than originally expected so that was a kind gesture as well. Definitely will be back on a less busy day.
Super fun place to take the kids while in Paris! They loved all the optical illusions especially the vortex!

I took my 9 year old son here and we both enjoyed it. The staff were friendly and helpful. The installations themselves were interesting and well put together. I'd advise you to take your time on each one as the museum is small. 1.5 hours is more than enough time to do this. We loved walking through the vortex tunnel and the chair and upside down illusions were fun to do. It's a shame the chair one isn't in a separate room as there were loads of people in the background of our photos.  The installations were classic ones and I gave 4 stars as I think that adding some more of the latest style illusions would really add something extra to the experience.  The location was great too as it was a short walk to restaurants, shops.
Less of a meusem more of an attraction. It's fairly compact but worth a visit. The tickets are not overly cheap..then it is Paris. Younger kids will definitely enjoy the visit.

We didn’t have any tickets. There was a line, but we didn’t wait too long. This was probably one of the highlights of our Paris trip. Unexpectedly fantastic. We loved it. Very interactive and super fun for kids like adults.
Its small and not worth for 19 euro ticket. A very less illusions which worth to see and also end result of photo not upto as expected. Disappointed. Not at all worth the price.

Quit impressive museum. Fun with kids. Buy tickets definitely in advance as you wait long in line. Some exhibitions should be renewed but still ok. Staff very helpful and friendly. Try to visit early in the morning or short before closing
It is very cool. I really liked it, especially the illusions which played tricks on your eyes. I really recommend it. It was one of the best things that i did in Paris.

In my opinion, it's not worth the expense. The attraction tends to be quite crowded, often requiring waiting in lines for a glimpse or a photo. It would greatly improve with fewer visitors per time slot or better organization to alleviate congestion. Half the time, frustration set in due to the long waits and others vying for views simultaneously. Some exhibits require time to read and appreciate. Even my 10-year-old found the arrangement dissatisfying. I wouldn't spend money on it, knowing what to expect. Booking in advance is essential to bypass the outdoor wait.

A good hour to spend laughing and discovering optic illusions. Loved the mirrored box where to get our head popping out of that box and the catwalk / bridge to cross straight but impossible to walk straight with the optic illusions turning around. A must with friends. Wheelchair friendly
The place was super crowded, kind of took the concentration of the artworks away, but that didn’t stop us from having a little fun, the reception were super nice and the illusions were fascinating.
Haven’t laughed so much, it’s amazing. Just really crazy sometimes.

Don’t go. It’s a robbery. Rush of people like world war Z. No attitude to customers. No cool atractions - 10minutes for 30€…. better eat a table of desserts or go to see some if the amazing spot in Paris
Fun and interactive museum. Made for kids and adults. It’s bit small, but interesting.
A great experience. Nice museum, lots of interactive games, kids a fab time. It's rather small but you can reexplore it again. Best on less busy days

This museum is a chain museum. If you have been to it in other country’s such as Berlin or Amsterdam the illusions in the museum are the exact same. Nothing new bit of a waste of money but enjoyable if it’s your first time going.

I do not recommend. It is too small. 1.75 floors. We asked at reception was there more. Exhibits are basic and well known. 3 good items Perspective bench. Upside down. Vertigo tunnel and mirror room. Needs 20 more items like them. Very unimpressed. Finished in 25 mins. For €19. Way overpriced. That is €45 an hour. Poor value. Similar museum in Lyon for cinema had 5 floors. Much better content. My son's choice of Paris attractions. He apologised  to me as we left.

sad that i cant rate this 0/5 16€ for students is way too overpriced. the museum is really small and there are not many impressive activities or illusions. its also very dirty and the mirrors aren’t clean so few illusions dont work. maybe a bit funny with little kids for 15 20 minutes but not the price worth.

My 10 year old niece had a great time here, but it's smaller than I expected for a fixed attraction in a city as big as Paris. The exhibits were interesting, though a little worn, don't rely on the young staff to soak English, ensure you've got some basic French or google translate.
This is an interesting museum, but too small to charge 19 euros entry. We can do the visit in less than 30 minutes . Overpriced . Nice exhibition though
It was quite fun, they had spots to tell you were to position your camera for the illusions to work the staff were friendly and it wasn't too busy so we could take our time getting good photos
Worth going, slightly expensive though, is a small place and ticket shouldn’t be more than 5 euro but it’s Paris what can you say.
Hhhmmmmm. It was “fine”. Interesting, intriguing, illuminating. Just. We did’t race but were done in thirty minutes. Probably one parent at a time whilst the other checks out DVD96TOYS.

It was okay. A bit overpriced but it was in a very nice district. I defo would not recommend paying the listed prices, wait for a coupon or something. You will be done with the museum in 30 min or less. Couple of nice illusions but overall it was a 2.
It's OK and something a bit different.  Some nice exhibits but felt it was too busy for the space available, they should limit the tickets a bit more.
It’s expensive for what it is! Very busy and didn’t think k it was worth the money… can’t recommend it. Use the time in Paris more wisely!
Really enjoyable experience, nice staff :) worth visiting

We've been there this summer during a weekday and there were not many people at this time. However, the price for value you get is not worth it. It's much cheaper to go to Louvre and see really valuable things.
Definitely a great place to go with kids for interactive fun! Very reasonably priced for a family too! Do yourself a favor though and book visit time before hand!

This museum is equally interesting for kids & adults. The staff at all points were welcoming, few were helping us with the photos inside. The perfect visit for the vacation as our girls were engrossed in the interactive displays! We did book out tickets in advance & the wait was not much.
It has been a lovely experience at the musee de lillusion in paris very fun especially for the family
a great experiebce for aall the family

Very entertaining museum, with surprising illusions in 2D and 3D (and most spectacular, moving 3D!). It's surprising how easily our mind can be tricked, and we spent a very good and fun time enjoying the illusions (and got some great photos of us interacting with them!)

This place is really fun! Has a quite few illusions here. It definitely messes with your mind a lot 😄. My recommendation would be to go here with your friends after a few drinks 😅.. It will be quite fun. …
#WhenInParis very VERY fun activity for all ages. Affordable, entertaining and educational .. definitely a must do for everyone!
